abstract: After years of feuding, the NFL Network and Comcast cut a deal about access to football games.
snippet: After years of feuding, the NFL Network and Comcast cut a deal about access to football games.
lead_paragraph: After all the fussing and feuding, all the talk about high-minded principles and spiraling costs, the NFL Network and Comcast did something they probably should have done all along: they cut a deal. As you undoubtedly recall, the two parties have been involved in a near blood feud these last two years because Comcast refused to put the NFL Network on its basic cable tier — at a cost of 75 cents a subscriber.

headline.main: Stop the Presses: N.F.L. and Comcast Kiss and Make Up
